result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron C Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.
  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim or any premises of hers.   Defendant may go to the residence at issue one time in the company of a uniformed law enforcement officer to retrieve his personal property.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

10:56. (15CM419/16CM14) Defendant, Aaron C Brown, in court, in custody with Attorney Jessica Marie Moeller.  Attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews plea agreement w/ Deft.  Court reviews chrgs + pnlts w/ Deft.  Deft enters Guilty plea to Ct. 2 in 15CM419; enters Guilty pleas to Ct. 1 + Ct. 3 in 16CM14.  Court reviews PQ/WOR w/ Deft.  Court finds suff fact basis, pleas made f/v/k/i and accepts pleas.  Court finds Deft guilty of Ct. 2 in 15CM419 and guilty of Cts 1 + 3 in 16CM14.  Court will D-RI Ct. 1 in 15CM419 and Ct. 2 in 16CM14.  Atty Tienstra heard. Attorney Moeller heard.  Statement by Deft.  Court heard and ORDERS:

sentence w/held (this is to all three counts)
probation for a period of 1 year
absolute sobriety
no contact w/ victim or any premise of hers (one time in company of DOSO or BDPD to collect items)
AODA + follow thru
counseling as recommended
court costs
DNA sample
will hold credit open; waiting on slip to set pre-sentence credit

Defendant Aaron C Brown in court with attorney Ramneek Singh Button.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Button heard - waiting for discovery; filed bond motion but State did not rec'v adequate notice of same; JT remains; bond motion set; bond cont.
11/5/15 Bail Hearing
from defendant's wife

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, PFB or her residence.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not go on the premises at 309 Front Street, Beaver Dam, WI, except Defendant may go to the residence at issue one time in the company of a uniformed law enforcement officer to retrieve his/her personal property.  Defendant shall not possess any firearms.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant Aaron C Brown in custody via video with attorney Ramneek Singh Button (may appoint).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. State heard on bond, $1000 cash; RD 11/30/15 at 3:30pm & JT 12/23/15 at 8:30am in Br. 1; Court sets $1,000.00 PA Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, PFB or her residence, except one time with officer.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not possess any firearms.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
